news_header: Apple's iPhone 16e offers AI features at a lower cost, aiming to boost sales amid declining iPhone demand.
news_original_title: Apple gambles on new iPhone with AI features at lower cost
news_text: Apple has announced the iPhone 16e, featuring AI capabilities at a lower price than flagship models. It shares the same processor as the iPhone 16 but has fewer cameras. Analysts are cautious about its sales impact, but it aims to attract consumers with enhanced AI functionality. The phone will be available for pre-order on February 21 in 59 countries, priced at £599 in the UK. This model is seen as a way to increase accessibility to Apple's ecosystem, particularly in markets like India.
